description: Shahidul Alam is a seasoned chef with 10 years of experience. He has created 150 delicious recipes and has amassed over 500 likes on his profile. His cooking style is focused on fusion dishes that blend traditional and modern techniques, creating unique and unforgettable flavors.
ingredients: 2 large hilsa fish, cut into pieces
cooking_method: Soak the mustard seeds in water for 30 minutes.
Drain the water and grind the mustard seeds into a fine paste.
Add the turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and salt to the mustard paste.
Mix well and keep aside.
Heat the mustard oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add the fish pieces and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Remove the fish from the pan and keep it aside.
In the same pan, add the green chillies and fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the mustard paste and fry for 2-3 minutes or until the oil separates from the mixture.
Add the water and bring it to a boil.
Add the fried fish pieces and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and fry until golden brown.
Add the ginger and garlic paste and fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the turmeric powder, red chilli powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder, and fry for another minute.
Add the prawns and salt, and fry for 2-3 minutes or until the prawns turn pink.
Add the coconut milk and green chillies, and simmer for 5-7 minutes or until the curry thickens.
Add the garam masala powder and mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.
Wash the rice and moong dal in water and soak for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pressure cooker over medium heat.
Add the sliced onions and fry until golden brown.
Add the ginger paste and garlic paste, and fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chilli powder, and garam masala powder, and fry for another minute.
Add the rice, moong dal, green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and salt, and mix well.
Add enough water to cover the rice and dal mixture completely.
Pressure cook for 2-3 whistles, or until the rice and dal are cooked through and the water has evaporated.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes before opening the lid.
Garnish with fried onions and serve hot with a side of raita.

description: Nurul Islam is a highly experienced chef with 15 years of experience. He has created over 250 recipes and has garnered over 800 likes on his profile. Nurul's cooking style is known for its complexity and his ability to create dishes with a wide range of flavors.
ingredients: 1 kg basmati rice, soaked in water for 30 minutes
1 kg lamb meat, cut into large chunks
cooking_method: Heat ghee in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and bay leaves, and fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the lamb meat and fry until browned on all sides.
Add the ginger paste and garlic paste, and fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, garam masala powder, turmeric powder, and salt, and fry for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the yogurt and mix well.
Cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and tender.
In a separate pot, bring water to a boil and add the soaked basmati rice.
Add salt and cook the rice until it is half done.
Drain the rice and set aside.
Preheat the oven to 180°C.
In a large baking dish, add half of the rice in a layer at the bottom.
Add the lamb meat and gravy on top of the rice layer.
Add the remaining rice on top of the lamb meat layer.
Sprinkle fried onions, raisins, and cashews on top of the rice layer.
Dissolve the saffron strands in a little bit of warm milk, and pour over the top layer of rice.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.
Preheat the oven to 180°C.
In a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, mustard oil, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, sugar, and salt.
Mix well to form a marinade.
Make 3-4 deep slits on the chicken, and apply the marinade all over the chicken, including the slits.
Stuff the green chillies, coriander leaves, and mint leaves inside the slits.
Cover the chicken and let it marinate for 4-5 hours in the refrigerator.
Take the chicken out of the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and add 1 cup of water to the pan.
Cover the chicken with foil and roast in the oven for 1 hour.
After 1 hour, remove the foil and brush the chicken with butter and lemon juice.
Roast the chicken for another 15-20 minutes, or until the skin is golden brown and crisp.
Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.

ingredients: 1 kg beef, cut into medium-sized pieces
cooking_method: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add the garlic, ginger, and green chillies, and sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the beef and stir well. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until the beef is browned on all sides.
Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala powder. Stir well to coat the beef evenly with the spices.
Add the sliced shatkora and salt to taste. Mix well and cook for 10-12 minutes or until the shatkora is soft and tender.
Add the yogurt and stir well. Cook for another 10-12 minutes or until the beef is fully cooked and the gravy has thickened.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

description: Farhan Ahmed is a skilled chef with 8 years of experience. She has created 100 recipes and has over 300 likes on her profile. Farhan's cooking style is focused on healthy and nutritious dishes that are both flavorful and satisfying.
cooking_method: In a mixing bowl, add rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery, cardamom powder, and salt. Mix well.
Gradually add water to the mixture and mix well to make a smooth batter.
Grease a small, round baking dish with oil. Pour the batter into the dish and smooth out the surface with a spatula.
Place the dish into a steamer and steam for 25-30 minutes or until the pitha is cooked through.
Remove the dish from the steamer and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, run a knife along the edge of the dish to loosen the pitha. Flip the dish over onto a plate to remove the pitha.
Serve the Bhapa Pitha warm or at room temperature.

ingredients: 1 kg beef, cut into medium-sized pieces
cooking_method: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add the garlic, ginger, and green chillies, and sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the beef and stir well. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until the beef is browned on all sides.
Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala powder. Stir well to coat the beef evenly with the spices.
Add salt to taste and stir well.
Cover the pot and cook on low heat for 45-50 minutes or until the beef is fully cooked and tender. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Remove the lid and increase the heat to high. Cook for another 5-7 minutes or until the gravy has thickened and the beef is nicely browned.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1 medium-sized bottle gourd (lauki/dudhi), peeled and diced
cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and green chillies, and sauté until the onion turns translucent.
Add the diced bottle gourd and potato, and mix well.
Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well.
Cover the pan and cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes or until the vegetables are fully cooked and soft. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
In a small pan, heat the ghee over low heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Pour the ghee and cumin seeds over the cooked vegetables and mix well.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

description: Mashrur Hossain is a seasoned chef with 12 years of experience. He has created 180 recipes and has amassed over 600 likes on his profile. Mashrur's cooking style is focused on traditional and authentic dishes that showcase the flavors and techniques of his home country.
cooking_method: Wash the rice in cold water and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
Heat the ghee in a large pot over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add the garlic, ginger, cardamom, cloves, and bay leaves, and sauté for another minute.
Add the chicken pieces and fry until browned on all sides.
Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add the yogurt and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the soaked rice and mix well. Fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and chicken are fully cooked and the water is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 5-10 minutes.
Fluff the rice and serve hot with raita or salad.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, onion, cilantro, mint leaves, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, and salt.
Add the egg and mix well. Knead the mixture for a few minutes until it is well combined.
Form the mixture into small patties, about 3-4 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the patties to the skillet and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, until browned and crispy.
Serve hot with mint chutney or yogurt sauce.
In a large bowl, mix together the rice flour and water to form a smooth dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
In another bowl, mix together the grated coconut, jaggery, and cardamom powder.
Divide the dough into small balls, about 2 inches in diameter. Flatten each ball with your palm to form a small disc.
Place a small amount of the coconut filling in the center of each disc. Fold the edges of the disc over the filling and seal the edges to form a ball. Flatten the ball slightly.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pitha to the skillet and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

description: Naim Hasan is a talented chef with 7 years of experience. She has created 120 recipes and has over 450 likes on her profile. Naim's cooking style is focused on simple and delicious dishes that can be made with everyday ingredients.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken, cut into small pieces
cooking_method: Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
Heat the ghee in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the bay leaves, cardamom pods, and cloves and fry for 1 minute.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and fry until browned. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala powder and fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the yogurt and fried onions to the pot and mix well. Add the soaked rice and mix well.
Add the water and salt to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and chicken are fully cooked.
In a separate pan, fry the cashew nuts and raisins until golden brown. Add them to the pot of rice and chicken and mix well.
Serve hot with raita or salad.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and oil. Gradually add the water, kneading the dough until it's smooth and elastic. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until it's softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for another minute.

Add the ground beef to the pan and cook until it's browned, breaking up any clumps with a spoon. Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, and salt, and cook for another 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool.
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a disc about 6 inches in diameter.

Take a portion of the stuffing and make a ball. Flatten it with your palm to make it disc-shaped. Place the disc on top of a dough disc and wrap the edges of the dough around the stuffing, pinching them together to seal it.

Heat 1 cup of vegetable oil in a deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the parathas until they're golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.
Peel the potatoes and cut them into small pieces. Boil the potatoes in a pot of water until they're soft.
Drain the water and mash the potatoes with a fork or potato masher.
Add the chopped onion, green chilies, mustard oil, and salt to the mashed potatoes. Mix well.
Heat the mixture in a frying pan over medium heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it's heated through.
Serve hot as a side dish with rice and dal.

description: Abdullah Al Mamun is a skilled chef with 9 years of experience. He has created 140 recipes and has over 550 likes on his profile. Abdullah's cooking style is focused on combining bold and unique flavors to create dishes that are both exciting and delicious.
cooking_method: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground fish, onion, green chilies, ginger paste, garlic paste, chickpea flour, salt, sugar, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well.
With damp hands, shape the mixture into small balls.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the fish balls and fry them until they're golden brown on all sides.

Add the water to the saucepan and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the fish balls are cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with rice.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the condensed milk, yogurt, sugar, cardamom powder, and rose water until it's smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish.
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and place it in a steamer. Steam it for 30-40 minutes over medium heat.
Remove the baking dish from the steamer and let it cool to room temperature.
Refrigerate the Bhapa Doi for at least 2 hours or until it's chilled.
Serve cold as a dessert.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cut the eggplant in half lengthwise and score the flesh in a crisscross pattern.
Sprinkle salt and turmeric powder on the eggplant halves and let them sit for 10 minutes.
Rinse the eggplant halves under running water and pat them dry with paper towels.
Heat the mustard oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add the chopped onions and sliced green chilies to the pan and sauté until the onions turn translucent.
Add the red chili powder and mix well.
Place the eggplant halves on the pan, skin side down.
Cover the pan with a lid and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the eggplant is soft and tender.
Add the sugar and mustard paste to the pan and mix well.
Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and let it cool.
Serve the Shorshe Begun with steamed rice.
